name: My Super Friends v0.2
description: Some minor changes to my version of a deck by Run Last Click's Eady. Took out some cards, added ice. This deck takes a while to get up to speed, but ends up becoming pretty rich pretty early with all the econ assets with high trash costs it runs. The main objective really here is to make a pretty secure server and throw Director Haas, Ash, and Caprice Nisei in and then have a grand old time from there.

name: My First Runner Deck
description: Turns out, even if you just have the core set, you can make a Criminal deck that isn't half bad. Who knew?

name: Panic Attack
description: Tag storm deck with SE. Pretty simple stuff here. Enjoy.

name: Broken Mirror
description: Fixed breaker suite, Parasite recursion, runs on fumes. With Spinal Modem, not for the weak of heart. Has built in SE protection with Borrowed Satellites. Don't wait to build the rig, just run.

name: Person of Interest
description:
"The Machine is always watching, ever vigilant for cyber-thieves who would pillage NBN's servers without hesitation. At the first signs of trouble, it tags potential threats to the system with pinpoint accuracy, and prevents the loss of information through evasive countermeasures. The thief's movements on the net are recorded for later 'prosecution'by the corporate cleaners. If you are a person of interest, you're already dead -- you just don't know it yet."

This deck looks similar to other NBN decks in that it runs Scorched Earth, sure, but that's just the tip of the iceberg. The main point of this deck is to tag your opponent -- not once, but multiple times. The more they're tagged, the better. One of the deck's main win conditions is to use Psychographics. So, for example, let's say the runner is tagged 5 times already (through sneaky use of Ghost Branchand perhaps a SEA Source). We already have a Project Bealeup to 3 advancement counters, and previously scored an AstroScript Pilot Program(which still has its counter). We Psychographics for 5, putting them all on Beale and remove the Script counter for 9 advancement counters total and we score it for 5 agenda points. You just won the game.

So, maybe the Runner decides to clear some tags during another game. He spends most of his turn clearing tags ($$$ down the drain for them). Maybe he has one tag left on him. Big Brother is watching him the whole time and tags him again a few times for good measure. Maybe he steals an agenda this turn, too.Midseason Replacements is there to provide some just retribution, and we use Psychographics on a Beale for 7 and immediately score 4 agenda points. Catch my drift now?

The Ice protecting our servers here isn't particularly expensive to rez, except maybe a well-timed Flare here or there to catch an unprepared Runner off-guard. Pop-up Window adds some much needed econ to the deck while ice like TMI, Viper and Wraparound add ETR effects to slow the Runner down. Matrix Analyzer and Muckraker help add some tags along the way while pushing the agendas forward simultaneously.

I'm always looking for critique since I'm a new player, so feel free to use the comments section to voice your opinion, and enjoy!

name: Taxing Fast Advance
description: Fast Advance out of hand, 10 assists/upgrades, 9 of which the runner has to go down your remote to get. Cheap ice, Elli on r and d for indexing, draco on hq for account syphon on the first turn. Wraparound and quandary are good on remotes to protect a melange or an early agenda and force a breaker to come out. tollbooth for late game, pop up to tax runners with no account syphon on hq when you have no agendas

name: Miles Dyson
description: Same Old Thing is mostly for recurring money cards.

name: Small Rigging
Aggressive Dino Lover 2.5
description:
Get your rig up fast, make money with Magnum Opus, tutor with Self-modifying Code

The breakers are pretty simple, the ones that sticks out a bit are Overmind, Deus X and Sharpshooter.

Overmind is a great card for early aggression, with spinal modem out, this bad boy can get 5 counters with CT, great for all the ice with one subroutine.

Sharpshooter and Deus X are my army knife tools, they are dead cards with some match ups, but really shine when you encounter a card that is really heavy (like Wall of Thorns [AP] or Archer [Destroyer])

name: HB Tax
description:
One of my favorite pre-Spin corp decks that seems to do well even when updated to Honor & Profit.

Keep the runner poor with cheap taxing ice. The runner either has to spend credits and clicks to remove tags or lose credits to Closed Accounts. Score agendas either in early game before the runner has set up their rig or in late game behind a towering glacier.

Use Accelerated Beta Test safely™ in combination with Jackson Howard. The deck has 23 ice so there is a good chance of success.

Card Choices

Eve Campaign is great in late game, but drains your credits in early game. I used to run three of them but decided to swap one for a copy of Subliminal Messaging that helps a bit in early game as well.

So far, I've played with Adonis Campaigns in place of Melanges, and if it seems that there aren't enough clicks to install all this ice, I might swap at least some of them back.

Modifications

  • Project Vitruvius (replaces NAPD Contract)
  • Adonis Campaign (replaces Melanage Mining Corp. for additional clicks)
  • Akitaro Watanabe (replaces Ash 2X3ZB9CY for additional economy)
  • Viper (frees up influence from Inazuma)
  • Dracō (frees up influence from Caduceus, bad synergy with Akitaro)
  • Pop-up Window (replaces Shadow, no synergy with Akitaro)
  • Wall of Static, Enigma, Datapike (replaces Rainbow)
  • Foxfire (for link-heavy meta)

Future Additions

  • Eden Fragment (replaces one Project Wotan)
  • Hades Fragment (replaces one Project Wotan)
  • Mother Goddess (replaces one Rainbow, not to be used with Rainbow)

name: Domestic Archer
Domestic Archer
NBN - Publishing a Penny Dreadful (Hobo Fast Advance) v.2.0
description:
Inspired by a deck mentioned by one of the guys on the San San South podcast, all cards in the deck cost three credits or less, with the aim being to score from zero credits with Shipment from San San's and utilising the advanceable ice as trick of light batteries.

The agendas are relatively standard FA stuff, Astros and Beales work as normal, NAPD contracts is there as a slightly safer agenda, whilst Market Research is there for just in case they stay tagged. If they don't stay tagged, I won't lose too much sleep over it.

Action Jackson is there for card draw, and marked accounts and pad campaigns are there for drip economy to score straight from the mandatory draw.

The ice is all cheap as chips. Ice wall and shadow are there as trick of light batteries, whilst matrix analyser will go on every server possible in an attempt to fuel the battery without spending any money.Quandry forces the inclusion of a fracter, paper wall generates a bit more money, whilst TMI actually gives some hard end the run.

Shipment from San San and trick of light are for scoring quickly from zero, sweeps week to quickly build up a small pool of credits. Closed accounts is on the off chance that they stay tagged, to give a scoring window. Red Herrings is designed to try and save an early astroscript, or a 2/4 if I am getting flooded.

I haven't actually tried this deck yet, so no idea how well or not it will function. As always, any thoughts or suggestions are much appreciated!

Update: having tested it, bloody hell it is nasty. Keeps the corp in the early game, forcing them to run, preferably theough matrix analysers building up a trick of light battery. Taken out one red herrings and one marked accounts and replaced them with psychographics. This deck piles the tags on,so makes sense to run them, even just two tags enables me to advance something two for one click.

name: Symbiosis
Anarch Virus
description: Here is my thoughts on a virus deck. Any suggestions will be welcome but I like to play with R&D pressure

name: Quality Time at the Rig
description:
Tutoring Anarch style... via Shaper. Brought in an experienced Magic player to learn the game, this is the nonsense it cranked out. Prepaids make Lucky Finds and Sure Gambles even more accessible and more bursty, and let you dig even faster with the Quality Times. Fixed breakers and Corroder mean you can be quick to get aggressive, but Datasuckers are easy to grab with QT or Djinn to keep things relevant. You absolutely eat through your deck, but if you manage to throw away 3 Déjà Vu and both Levy AR Lab Accesses, you've got bigger issues.

FoN is currently untested, as a circumstantial "Yog just...can't." solution. Odds are good you'll QT through it, which leaves it nice and easy to abuse your VoicePAD credits to Retrieval Run it out at little or no cost to you. Prior alternative was a third Imp.

Comments/Criticism welcome.

name: Jinkteki no ice
description: Look no ice

name: NBN... Iceless? V1.0
description:
This is a bad idea. I'm just going to put that out there.

The basic idea is to play shell games and let them steal an agenda, preferably TGTBT, then punish them for their tags with Scorched Earth, Closed Accounts, and Bad Times.

Score Breaking News from hand when you have it, use your identity and Jackson to get your combo pieces, and keep your economy as high as possible with Hedge Fund and Sweeps Week. They might attempt to trash Private Contracts and Marked Accounts, but that's alright because the fewer credits they have the stronger your trace will be as well.

Midseason Replacements after they grab an agenda and follow up with Psychographics.

With any luck, they won't expect to hit cards like Snare! Better still is Psychic field, since it will hit them when they expose as well.

I plan to test this build, but I expect luck will play a large part in my games. Will post any further results, and let me know if anyone has any feedback.

name: Modern Andriods
description: A rush designed to force agendas out as quickly as possible and not caring about money. Inazuma is there to extend the usefulness of the other pieces of ice. Asset economy is certainly a bit risky, but with 21 pieces of ice you have the resources to defend it. Clicking for credits is a good use of your time in this deck because almost all the ice is around 3 credits. Also Haas Arcology AI is fantastic because it is cheaper for this deck than biotic labor (and can be used more times). One or two advancements is probably fine, though more is obviously better (4 is the number needed to win the game). I haven't faced account siphon yet, but it's pretty easy to get two cheap etr pieces of ice on HQ which should make it hard to land AS.

name: Bored Games
description: Deck aims to have Rook on the table to enable easy runs while Underworld Contact(s) pours money onto the table. There's a bit of clicking for money in the early game, but if an Underworld Contact is running, then things get much easier. Top target for Hostage is Mr. Li because he can sift through the deck very quickly. John comes in later once the servers are soft enough over the course of the game. Rook'd ice gets trashed fairly frequently, opening up easy Pawn promotion plays to reintroduce pressure. I would rather not play The Helpful AI, but searchable Link is too good to pass up as a backup. Even with Overmind, I prefer Access to Globalsec over Dyson because of the cheaper install cost. Corroder is in there mainly for Himitsu-Bako; keeping Knights off Wraparounds is just a bonus. Mimic is there mainly for Swordsman. Tallie hoses most of the Weyland playstyle, but her alone doesn't stop a SEA Source, Double Scorched play against a corp that started its turn with zero bad publicity. Joshua B. doesn't mesh well with this playstyle. The corp has to earn their tags.

name: Kit Yog
A Link to Roja
description: Trying to build a link based Roja deck not sure it will work any ideas welcome

name: CT - Logos - Overmind (C.L.OVER)
description:
Playing around with the idea of including Logos in a Shaper deck. Shaper consoles aren't great, and Logos seems to fit right in with the tutor-centric faction. It's relatively cheap, has low INF and adds an MU.

Coupled with the CT +1MU, this seems to be a nice fit for an Overmind/Knight aggression & recursion deck, and provides some back up in the event an agenda slips by.

Stimhacks splashed for those must-get-in Overmind runs. The rest is pretty straight-forward Shaper recursion and R&D lock.

Will be play testing this week and seeing how things go. Thoughts welcome!

name: First Shaper Deck
description: My first shot at building a Shaper deck. Key is putting programs on Personal Workshop and then using money from Stimhackto pay for them. Gorman Drip v1 and Cyberfeeder help generate money along with Magnum Opus.

name: The Fastest Hobo in the United States
description:
Because a number of people online and IRL have been asking for it... This is the latest iteration of my 'Hobo NBN FA'. The idea is to advance an Ice Wall twice when you get it and use Trick of Light to score your first Astro. Then Jackson and Fast Track to get the remaining points. Choo choo!

You usually don't need more than two credits floating to score which means this works really well against Siphon/Vamp. ICE is cheap end the run with the exception of a single Tollbooth to lock out / tax in the mid to late game. SanSan is an alternate scoring option but might as well read, "the runner loses a click and 5 credits".

Feel free to provide feedback. Appreciate it!

Kenny

name: The Oracle May See You Now
description: I played a deck at my local regionals that had this same conceit and I thought I'd try it out because it seemed fun. Mulligan into an Oracle May if you must and just dig through the deck, tutoring out the three programs. With the amount of events, you should use Oracle to call event every turn and get a card draw and two credits. It's pretty goofy.

name: Grndl Bug 3.3
Haas Bioroid BrainPain
Know Your Enemy
description:
Basic Strategy: Get Blackguard out ASAP, and expose everything. Know what ICE you are running into so you have what you need going in, or just force the Corp to rez it and jack out (while profiting with Compromised Employees).

Main break is the Overmind/e3 combo, assisted by CyberSolutions Mem Chips for added tokens. Knight/e3 also a viable combo. Early game economy in events and Armitage, late game in Kati Jones.

name: Haas Bioroid BrainPain
"Good Guy" Weyland 1.1
description:
So I’ve learned in the past that I’m not really all that good with Weyland. I’d typically have a good start, getting 4-5 points was common, but then the runner would come back and just utterly shut me down thanks in no small part to the BP I’ve accumulated.

So one day after having played HB for a while I thought I’d take a crack at a “good guy” Weyland – i.e. a Weyland without BP. And it worked better than I though it would so I though I’d post it up for comment.

Regardless of the whole no BP thing this play like a standard Weyland, rush while you can, then use a combination of Power Shutdown and NADP Contract to force timing windows you can exploit to finish out the game. In the ideal scenario you’d score either an over scored Atlas or a Cleaners in the Rush phase so you can threaten Scorch to slow people down.

Probably the biggest “issue” this deck has is that it doesn’t have an ID that really supports it, but I think with a few tweaks this could be a competitive Blue Sun deck.

Final note, when upstalk comes out you should swap something for The Root, it should be great in this deck.

name: Symbiosis
You'll never be good enough...
Noise - Schehexually Transmitted Diseases v0.2
